messages.name: IMC
messages.author: Ricardo Martins, Paulo Sousa Dias, Eduardo Marques, José Pinto
messages.description:
This document describes the communications protocol associated with the USTL software framework. Concepts such as message, field and packet are explained in detail in the subsequent chapters.

Inter module communication is achieved by the exchange of messages that can be recognized and interpreted by all participating modules. A message is a self-contained collection of data fields conveying relevant information about a given subject. The mean by which the messages are exchanged is not described in this document, but the reader can assume that at least the UDP Internet protocol is available at all ends of the communications channel.

The Neptus Command and Control Unit (CCU), currently being used at USTL, supports mission planning and control, using the described messaging API. This software entity can be used to define a plan before execution and monitor the plan's execution by presenting an operating console. For further details on this software contact the USTL.

A CCU exercises authority over a vehicle (real or simulated). Usually this term is applied to software in the class of USTL Neptus, but can also be applied to software modules extending the vehicle core control software.

The USTL reserves itself the right to use message identification numbers up to 999. Thus if a 3rd party needs to extend this API it must use identification numbers starting at 1000. The identification number 65535 has a special meaning and must not be used to extend the IMC protocol.

types.description: Messages and packets can be viewed as a finite collection of fields. The list of valid field types is presented below.

type.name: fp32_t
type.description: 32 bit single precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: fp64_t
type.description: 64 bit double precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: message
type.description: An inline message. Useful for encapsulating other messages.

serialization.description: To ensure accurate transportation some field types may require special treatment on transmission and reception. The operation of preparing a field type for transmission is called serialization, the inverse action is called deserialization. No special serialization is required for types that are not described in the table below, their values should be used as is.

type.name: rawdata
type.description: A sequence of type rawdata is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of bytes. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct size of data bytes. The rawdata type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: plaintext
type.description: A sequence of type plaintext is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of ASCII characters. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct ASCII character sequence size. The plaintext type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: message
type.description: A field of type message is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the identification number of the message, to the serialized message payload. The special identification number 65535 must be used when no message is present. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct message identification number. The message type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: message-list
type.description: A field of type message-list is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the number of messages in the list, to the serialized message payload. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct number of messages

units.description: The following table lists the units used in the subsequent chapters.

unit.name: List of key/value tuples
unit.description: This unit is a list of label/value tuples and is only valid in plaintext fields. The label and value portions of a tuple are separated using the equal sign (=) and tuples are separated using the semicolon character (;). These delimiting characters must not be used elsewhere. Leading and trailing semicolons must be removed. Examples: "label1=12;label2=3" or "label1=12" or "label1=test_2".

def.name: Interfacing Level
def.description: Allows request or handover of IL 2, 3, 4 and 5.

header.description: The packet header contains handling information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the beginning of a packet.

field.name: Synchronization Number
field.description:
The synchronization number marks the beginning of a packet. It denotes the packet API version and can be used to deduce the byte order of the sending host.
It encodes value 0xFE where major equals the major version number of the protocol and minor equals the minor version of the protocol. The packet recipient is responsible for the correct interpretation of the synchronization number and byte order conversions.

field.name: Message Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the message contained in the packet. This field is used for correct message interpretation and deserialization.

field.name: Message size
field.description: The size of the message data in the packet. The maximum allowed value is 65535.

field.name: Time stamp
field.note: Correct interpretation of this field may require synchronization of clocks between sender and recipient
field.description: The time when the packet was sent, as seen by the packet dispatcher. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970 using IEEE double precision floating point numbers.

field.name: Source Entity
field.description: The entity generating this message at the source address

field.name: Destination Entity
field.description: The entity that should process this message at the destination address

footer.description: The packet footer contains validation information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the end of a packet.

field.name: Check Sum (CRC-16-IBM)
field.description: The check sum field is computed using the CRC-16-IBM with polynomial 0x8005 (x^16 + x^15 + x^2 + 1). The data contributing for the CRC includes all preceding header and message bytes.

message.name: Entity State
message.description:
State reported by an entity in the vehicle.

The source entity is identified in the message header.

field.name: Complementary description
field.description: Complementary human-readable description of entity state.

message.name: Query Entity State
message.description:
Request entities to report their state.

Entities should respond by issuing an appropriate EntityState message.

message.name: Entity Information
message.description: This message describes an entity.

field.name: Label
field.description: Entity label or empty if the entity id is not valid.

field.name: Component name
field.description: Name of the plugin/component associated with this entity (e.g. in DUNE this is the task name)

message.name: Query Entity Information
message.description: This message requests information about an entity. It is useful to resolve device ids.

message.name: Entity List
message.description: This message describes the names and identification numbers of all entities in the system

message.name: Entity Control
message.description: Control the activity of entities.

message.name: CPU Usage
message.description: Report of software CPU usage.

field.name: Usage percentage
field.description: The CPU usage, in percentage, of the sending software.

message.name: Transport Bindings
message.description: Message generated when tasks bind to messages.

field.name: Consumer name
field.description: The name of the consumer (e.g. task name)

field.name: Message Identifier
field.description: The id of the message to be listened to

message.name: Acknowledged Message
message.description: This message is used to transport inline messages with acknowledgemente receipts

field.name: Operation
field.description: This field denotes the type of operation of the message (delivery or acknowledgement)

field.name: Session Id
field.description: A two-byte identifier to be used as a channel of communication.

field.name: Message argument
field.description: This field onl makes sense for the "SEND" operation. This is the message that should be delivered. The header fields "time", "src", "src_ent", "dst", "dst_ent", should be copied from the parent "AckedMessage" message.

message.name: Simulated State
message.description: This message presents the simulated state of the vehicle.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset down (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw rate).

field.name: Stream Velocity X (North)
field.description: Stream Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Stream Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Stream Velocity zz axis velocity component.

message.name: Leak Simulation
message.description: Simulate leak behavior.

field.name: Leak Entities
field.description: Comma separated list of leak entities (empty for all leaks configured).

message.name: Underwater Acoustics Simulation
message.description: Underwater acoustics simulation request.

message.name: Storage Usage
message.description: Report of storage usage.

field.name: Available
field.description: The available storage of the reporting device.

field.name: Usage
field.description: The percentage of storage used by the reporting device.

message.name: Cache Control
message.description: Control message caching to persistent storage.

field.name: Snapshot destination
field.description: Destination for the cache snapshot file.

message.name: Logging Control
message.description: Control message logging to persistent storage.

value.name: Request Start of Logging
value.description: Request the logging manager to start logging. The logging manager will reply with a STARTED operation. If logging is already in progress the current log will be closed and a new one will be opened (therefore the logging manager will send two messages - STOPPED and STARTED). The field 'name' represents the label that will be appended to the log path.

value.name: Logging Started
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation everytime a log is successfully started. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

value.name: Request Logging Stop
value.description: Request the logging manager to stop logging messages. The logging manager will reply with a STOPPED operation and logging will be suspended until a message with operation START is received. If logging is already stoppped the logging manager will ignore this operation and will not reply with a STOPPED operation. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

value.name: Logging Stopped
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when logging is successfully stopped. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log that was closed.

value.name: Request Current Log Name
value.description: This operation instructs the logging manager to send a message with operation CURRENT_NAME containing the complete name of the current log in the field 'name'. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

value.name: Current Log Name
value.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when asked via the REQUEST_CURRENT_NAME operation. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

field.name: Log Label / Path
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

message.name: Log Book Entry
message.description: Human readable message reporting an event of interest.

message.name: Log Book Control
message.description: Control history log.

value.name: Get
value.description: Retrieve log book entries

value.name: Clear
value.description: Clear log book entries

value.name: Get Errors
value.description: Retrieve log book entries corresponding to errors.

value.name: Reply
value.description: Reply to a GET command. Message argument is a MessageList instance containing LogBookEntry messages.

message.name: Replay Control
message.description: Control replay of LSF logged data.

message.name: Clock Control
message.description: Clock control.

value.name: Execute Sync.
value.description: Synchronize clock according to given clock value.

value.name: Request Sync.
value.description: Request autonomous clock synchronization.

value.name: Sync. Started
value.description: Synchronization start notification.

value.name: Sync. done
value.description: Synchronization completion notification.

value.name: Set Timezone
value.description: Set timezone.

value.name: Timezone Setup
value.description: Notification due to timezone modification.

message.name: Heartbeat
message.description: The Heartbeat message is used to inform other modules that the sending entity's system is running normally and communications are alive.

message.name: Announce
message.description: A system description that is to be broadcasted to other systems.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint. If lat=0 & lon=0 means location value is unknown.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint. If lat=0 & lon=0 means location value is unknown.

field.name: Height WGS-84
field.description: Altitude above WGS-84 geoid (UAVs), should be negative when underwater (AUVs).

field.name: Services
field.description: Semicolon separated list of URLs. Examples of such URLs are "imc+udp://192.168.106.34:6002/", "dune://0.0.0.0/uid/1294925553839635/" and "http://192.168.106.34/dune/".

message.name: Announce Service
message.description: An URL typed of services to use. See Announce message for more info. This message is essentially used internally in order to register services. The Announce message will be the one to disseminate the info externally.

message.name: Receive Signal Strength Information
message.description: Measure of the RSSI by a networking device.

field.name: Value
field.description:
Measurement of link level quality.

For instance, this may correspond to the acknowledgment ratio of a link. But, generally, the measure is link-dependent.

message.name: SMS
message.description: Send a SMS message.

message.name: LBL Range
message.description: When the vehicle uses Long Base Line navigation, this message notifies that a new range was received from one of the acoustics transponders. The message fields are used to identify the range value and the transponder name.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

message.name: LBL Detection
message.description: Report of an LBL detection.

message.name: LBL Beacon Configuration
message.description: Position and configuration of an LBL transponder (beacon).

message.name: Acoustic Range
message.description: Issue an acoustic range command.

message.name: Acoustic Range Reply
message.description: Acoustic range measure in response to a range command.

field.name: Status
field.description: Status indicating reply to range request.

field.name: Range
field.description: Range measure obtained. Usable if status indicates successful reply.

message.name: Acoustic Message
message.description: Send an acoustic message.

message.name: Acoustic Diagnostic
message.description: Enable/Disable Acoustic Diagnostic

message.name: Acoustic Noise
message.description: Report on the conditions of the underwater medium, for when acoustic diagnostics are enabled.

message.name: Acoustic Ping
message.description: Ping remote modem.

message.name: Acoustic Ping Reply
message.description: Acoust Ping Reply.

message.name: Acoustic Operation
message.description: Acoustic operation.

value.name: Abort
value.description: Send an abort through the acoustic channel to the system specified in the field 'system'.

value.name: Abort in Progress
value.description: The latest abort request to the system specified in the field 'system' is in progress.

value.name: Abort Timeout
value.description: The latest abort operation expired without acknowledgment from the system specified in the field 'system'.

value.name: Abort Acknowledged
value.description: The latest abort operation was acknowledged by the system specified in the field 'system'.

value.name: Range Request
value.description: Request a range through the acoustic channel to the system specified in the field 'system'.

value.name: Range in Progress
value.description: The latest range request to the system specified in the field 'system' is in progress.

value.name: Range Timeout
value.description: The latest range request operation expired without reply from the system specified in the field 'system'.

value.name: Range Received
value.description: The latest range request operation to the system specified in the field 'system' was successful and the range is specified in the field 'range'.

value.name: Modem is Busy
value.description: The acoustic modem is busy and cannot execute the requested operation.

value.name: Unsupported operation
value.description: The latest requested operation is not supported.

value.name: Transducer Not Detected
value.description: The transducer was not detected.

value.name: Send Message
value.description: Request message over acoustic channel. The message to send is specified by the 'msg' field.

value.name: Message Send -- Queued
value.description: Message send request has been queued.

value.name: Message Send -- In progress
value.description: Message send request is in progress.

value.name: Message Send -- Done
value.description: Message send request has been fulfilled.

value.name: Message Send -- Failure
value.description: Message send request could not be fulfilled.

value.name: Send Short Message
value.description: Request message over acoustic channel. The message to send is specified by the 'msg' field.

field.name: System
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

field.name: Range
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

message.name: Rotations Per Minute
message.description: Number of rotations per minute.

message.name: Voltage
message.description: Report of electrical voltage.

field.name: Measured Voltage Value
field.description: The value of the internal electrical voltage as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Current
message.description: Report of electrical current.

field.name: Measured Current Value
field.description: The value of the internal electrical current as measured by the sensor.

message.name: GPS Fix
message.description: Report of a GPS fix.

value.name: Valid Date
value.description: Fields 'utc_year', 'utc_month' and 'utc_day' are valid.

value.name: Valid Time
value.description: Field 'utc_time' is valid.

value.name: Valid Position
value.description: Fields 'lat', 'lon', 'altitude' and 'satellites' are valid.

value.name: Valid Course Over Ground
value.description: Field 'cog' is valid.

value.name: Valid Speed Over Ground
value.description: Field 'sog' is valid.

value.name: Valid Horizontal Accuracy Estimate
value.description: Field 'hacc' is valid.

value.name: Valid Vertical Accuracy Estimate
value.description: Field 'vacc' is valid.

value.name: Valid Horizontal Dilution of Precision
value.description: Field 'hdop' is valid.

value.name: Valid Vertical Dilution of Precision
value.description: Field 'vdop' is valid.

value.name: Stand Alone
value.description: Stand alone solution.

value.name: Differential
value.description: Differential solution.

value.name: Dead Reckoning
value.description: Dead reckoning solution.

value.name: Manual Input
value.description: Manual solution.

value.name: Simulation
value.description: Simulated solution.

field.name: UTC Time of Fix
field.description: UTC time of the GPS fix measured in seconds since 00:00:00 (midnight).

field.name: Number of Satellites
field.description: Number of satellites viewed by the GPS device at the time of the fix.

field.name: UTC Time of Fix
field.description: UTC time of the rejected GPS fix measured in seconds since 00:00:00 (midnight).

message.name: Euler Angles
message.description: Report of spatial orientation according to SNAME's notation (1950).

field.name: Roll Angle
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle longitudinal axis.

field.name: Pitch Angle
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle lateral or transverse axis.

field.name: Yaw Angle (True)
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle vertical axis. A value of 0 means the vehicle is oriented towards true north. In cases where the sensor cannot measure the true heading, this field will have the same value as Yaw (Magnetic).

field.name: Yaw Angle (Magnetic)
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle vertical axis. A value of 0 means the vehicle is oriented towards magnetic north. In cases where the sensor cannot measure the magnetic heading, this field will have the same value as Yaw (True).

message.name: Angular Velocity
message.description: Vector quantifying the direction and magnitude of the measured angular velocity that a device is exposed to.

message.name: Acceleration
message.description: Vector quantifying the direction and magnitude of the measured acceleration that a device is exposed to.

message.name: Magnetic Field
message.description: Vector quantifying the direction and magnitude of the measured magnetic field that a device is exposed to.

message.name: Ground Velocity
message.description: Vehicle velocity relative to the ground.

field.name: Validity
field.description: Each bit of this field represents if a given velocity component is valid.

message.name: Water Velocity
message.description: Water velocity.

field.name: Validity
field.description: Each bit of this field represents if a given velocity component is valid.

message.name: Distance
message.description: Distance measurement.

value.name: Invalid
value.description: Measurement is invalid.

value.name: Valid
value.description: Measurement is valid.

field.name: Instrument Position - X
field.description: Instrument's position over the X axis.

field.name: Instrument Position - Y
field.description: Instrument's position over the Y axis.

field.name: Instrument Position - Z
field.description: Instrument's position over the Z axis.

field.name: Instrument Rotation - X
field.description: Instrument's rotation over the X axis.

field.name: Instrument Rotation - Y
field.description: Instrument's rotation over the Y axis.

field.name: Instrument Rotation - Z
field.description: Instrument's rotation over the Z axis.

field.name: Beam Width
field.description: Beam width of the instrument. A negative number denotes that this information is not available or is not applicable.

field.name: Beam Height
field.description: Beam height of the instrument. A negative number denotes that this information is not available or is not applicable.

message.name: Temperature
message.description: Report of temperature.

field.name: Measured Temperature
field.description: The value of the temperature as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Pressure
message.description: Report of external pressure.

field.name: Measured Pressure
field.description: The value of the pressure as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Depth
message.description: Depth report.

field.name: Measured Depth
field.description: Depth value measured by a sensor.

message.name: Depth Offset
message.description: Report of Depth Offset.

message.name: Sound Speed
message.description: Sound Speed report.

field.name: Computed Sound Speed
field.description: Estimated sound speed. Negative values denote invalid estimates.

message.name: Water Density
message.description: Water Density report.

message.name: Conductivity
message.description: Report of conductivity.

field.name: Measured Conductivity
field.description: The value of the conductivity as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Salinity
message.description: Report of salinity.

field.name: Measured Salinity
field.description: The value of the salinity as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Wind Speed
message.description: Measurement of wind speed.

message.name: Relative Humidity
message.description: Measurement of relative humidity.

message.name: Device Data (Text)
message.description: Verbatim representation of device data in plain text format

field.name: Value
field.description: Plain text data as extracted directly from the device

message.name: Device Data (Binary)
message.description: Verbatim representation of device data in binary format

field.name: Value
field.description: Raw binary data as extracted directly from the device

message.name: Sonar Configuration
message.description: This message contains high-level runtime configuration parameters for Sonars.

message.name: Sonar Data
message.description: This message contains the data acquired by a single sonar measurement.

message.name: Pulse
message.description: Hardware pulse detection.

message.name: Fuel Level
message.description: Report of fuel level.

field.name: Confidence Level
field.description: Percentage level of confidence in the estimation of the amount of energy in the batteries.

field.name: Operation Modes
field.description: Operation mode name and the estimated time available in that mode in hours. Example: "Motion=1.5"

message.name: Camera Zoom
message.description: Camera Zoom.

field.name: Camera Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination camera.

message.name: Set Thruster Actuation
message.description: Actuate directly on a thruster.

field.name: Thruster Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination thruster.

message.name: Set Servo Position
message.description: Set the position of a servo.

message.name: Set Control Surface Deflection
message.description: Set the deflection angle of a control surface.

message.name: Remote Actions Request
message.description: This message is used as query to request for the possible remote actions (operation=QUERY and the list is empty in this case). The vehicle responds using the same message type returning the tuplelist with the pairs: Action,Type (operation=REPORT). The type of action can be Axis, Hat or Button.

message.name: Remote Actions
message.description: This message is used to send a periodic update of values for each remote action. If the action is not on the list the assumed value is 0.

message.name: LCD Control
message.description: Control LCD.

message.name: Power Operation
message.description: This message allows controlling the system's power lines.

value.name: Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices immediately. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Down in Progress
value.description: The latest power down request is in progress and the time remaining until power down is given in field 'time_remain'.

value.name: Power Down Aborted
value.description: The latest power down request was aborted.

value.name: Schedule Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices.

value.name: Power Up in Progress
value.description: The latest power up request is in progress.

value.name: Schedule Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power up.

message.name: Power Channel Control
message.description: This message allows controlling power channels.

field.name: Channel
field.description: Power channel identification number. The number 255 means all channels.

value.name: Turn Off
value.description: Turn off power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Turn On
value.description: Turn on power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Toggle
value.description: Toggle power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Schedule Turn On
value.description: Turn on power channel specified in field 'id' in 'sched_time' seconds.

value.name: Schedule Turn Off
value.description: Turn off power channel specified in field 'id' in 'sched_time' seconds.

value.name: Reset Schedules
value.description: Reset all scheduled operations for the channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Save Current State
value.description: Save the current state of the channel 'id' to persistent storage.

message.name: Query Power Channel State
message.description: Request the state of power channels.

message.name: Power Channel State
message.description: Message conveying the state of a power channel.

value.name: Off
value.description: Power channel is off.

value.name: On
value.description: Power channel is on.

message.name: LED Control
message.description: Message to control the state of Light-emitting diodes (LEDs).

value.name: Turn Off
value.description: Turn off LED.

value.name: Turn On
value.description: Turn on LED.

value.name: Toggle
value.description: Toggle LED state.

message.name: Estimated State
message.description:
This message presents the state of the vehicle.
  • An absolute Lat/Lon/Height point and NED offsets (x, y, z) computed using the Lat/Lon/Height sent as the reference point.
    • The symbols for position and attitude as well as linear and angular speeds were chosen according to SNAME's notation (1950). The body-fixed reference frame and Euler angles are depicted next:

    Figure 3 - Euler angles

field.name: Offset north
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Offset east
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Offset down
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity X (North)
field.description: Ground Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Ground Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Ground Velocity zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw).

field.name: Depth
field.description: Depth, in meters. To be used by underwater vehicles. Negative values denote invalid estimates.

field.name: Altitude
field.description: Altitude, in meters. Negative values denote invalid estimates.

message.name: Estimated Stream Velocity
message.description: The estimated stream velocity, typically for water or air streams.

message.name: Navigation Uncertainty
message.description: Report of navigation uncertainty.

message.name: Navigation Reset
message.description: Request a navigation reset.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired heading angle, relative to true north, in radians.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired depth in meters. Use negative values for altitude.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired speed, in the scale specified by the "Speed Units" field.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the speed value.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired roll angle.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired pitch angle.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired vertical rate speed in meters per second.

message.name: Desired Path
message.description:
Perform path control.

The path is specified by two WGS-84 waypoints, respective altitude / depth settings, optional loitering at the end point, and some control flags.

The start and end waypoints are defined by the specified end point fields ('end_{lat/lon/z}') plus: (1) the start waypoint fields ('start_{lat|lon|z}') if the 'START' flag (bit in 'flags' field) is set; or (2) the end point of the previous path recently tracked; or (3) the current location is the 'DIRECT' flag is set or if the tracker has been idle for some time.

Altitude and depth control can be performed as follows: (1) by default, the tracker will just transmit an altitude/depth reference value equal to 'end_z' to the appropriate controller; (2) if the 'NO_Z' flag is set no altitude/depth control will take place, hence they can be controlled independently; (3) if the '3DTRACK' flag is set, 3D-tracking will be done (if supported by the active controller).

Loitering can be specified at the end point with a certain radius ('lradius'), duration ('lduration'), and clockwise or counter-clockwise direction ('CCLOCKW' flag).

field.name: Start Point -- Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the start point's z reference

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the end point's z reference

field.name: Loiter -- Radius
field.description: Radius for loitering at end point. Specify less or equal to 0 for no loitering.

value.name: Start Point
value.description: Indicates that the start point specification is given, therefore it should be considered for tracking.

value.name: Direct
value.description: If start point is not given, ignore also the previous path's endpoint and take the start point to be the current vehicle location.

value.name: No Altitude/Depth control
value.description: Ignore altitude/depth setting and let them be controlled independently.

value.name: 3D Tracking
value.description: Perform 3D-tracking, i.e., consider the path formed in the XYZ plane taking into account both the 'start_z' and 'end_z' values.

value.name: Counter-Clockwise loiter
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done counter-clockwise. Clockwise loitering will apply otherwise.

value.name: Loiter from current position
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done from the current vehicle position. The end_lat and end_lon fields will be ignored.

message.name: Desired Control
message.description: Set the desired virtual forces and torques to be applied to the vehicle.

field.name: Force along the x axis
field.description: Force X along the vehicle's x axis

field.name: Force along the y axis
field.description: Force Y along the vehicle's y axis

field.name: Force along the z axis
field.description: Force Z along the vehicle's z axis

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque K about the vehicle's x axis

field.name: Torque about the y axis
field.description: Torque M about the vehicle's y axis

field.name: Torque about the z axis
field.description: Torque N about the vehicle's z axis

value.name: Value of X is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field X has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of Y is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field Y has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of Z is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field Z has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of K is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field K has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of M is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field M has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of N is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field N has a meaningful value.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired heading rate speed in radians per second.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired altitude in meters.

message.name: Path Control State
message.description: Path control state.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the start point's z reference

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter should be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the end point's z reference

field.name: Loiter -- Radius
field.description: Radius for loitering at end point. Will be 0 if no loitering is active.

value.name: Near Endpoint
value.description: Set if near the target endpoint.

value.name: Loitering
value.description: Set if loitering.

value.name: No Altitude/Depth control
value.description: Altitude/depth being controlled independently.

value.name: 3D Tracking
value.description: 3D-tracking is active.

value.name: Counter-Clockwise loiter
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if active, is being done counter-clockwise. Otherwise, clockwise loitering should be assumed.

field.name: Estimated Time to Arrival (ETA)
field.description: Estimated time to reach target waypoint. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined, and 0 when loitering.

message.name: Allocated Control Torques
message.description: Control torques allocated to the actuators.

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque K about the vehicle's x axis

field.name: Torque about the y axis
field.description: Torque M about the vehicle's y axis

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque N about the vehicle's z axis

message.name: Control Parcel
message.description: Report of control parcels.

message.name: Desired Velocity
message.description: Desired value for each linear and angular speeds.

field.name: Desired Linear Speed in xx
field.description: Desired speed along the vehicle's x axis

field.name: Desired Linear Speed in yy
field.description: Desired speed along the vehicle's y axis

field.name: Desired Linear Speed in zz
field.description: Desired speed along the vehicle's z axis

field.name: Desired Angular Speed in xx
field.description: Desired speed about the vehicle's x axis

field.name: Desired Angular Speed in yy
field.description: Desired speed about the vehicle's y axis

field.name: Desired Angular Speed in zz
field.description: Desired speed about the vehicle's z axis

value.name: Value of u is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field u has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of v is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field u has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of w is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field w has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of p is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field p has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of q is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field q has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of r is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field r has a meaningful value.

message.name: Goto Maneuver
message.description:
A "Goto" is a maneuver specifying a movement of the vehicle to a target waypoint. The waypoint is described by the WGS-84 waypoint coordinate and target depth.

Mandatory parameters defined for a "Goto" timeout and speed.

Optional parameters be defined for the target Euler Angles (pitch, yaw and roll) though these parameters may not be considered by all maneuver controllers in charge of the execution of this type of maneuver.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Target reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Roll
field.description: The the phi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be unconsidered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be disconcerted. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be considered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

message.name: Popup Maneuver
message.description: The Pop Up maneuver makes the vehicle come to the surface at a specific waypoint. This is used in underwater vehicles.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Duration
field.description: The duration of this maneuver at surface level. Use '0' for unlimited duration time.

message.name: Teleoperation Maneuver
message.description: The Teleoperation Maneuver lets the vehicle be controlled by an external human operator.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The timeout indicates the time that an error should occur if exceeded.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Duration
field.description: The duration of this maneuver. Use '0' for unlimited duration time.

message.name: Idle Maneuver
message.description: Causes the vehicle to stay idle for some time.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Optional duration of the Idle maneuver. Use '0' for unlimited duration time (maneuver will have to be explicitly stopped).

message.name: Low Level Control Maneuver
message.description: Low level maneuver that sends a (heading, roll, speed, ...) reference to a controller of the vehicle and then optionally lingers for some time.

field.name: Control
field.description: Control command: can be of type DesiredDepth, DesiredHeading, DesiredRoll, DesiredPitch, DesiredSpeed, or DesiredPath.

message.name: Rows Maneuver
message.description: Rows maneuver

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Path Points
field.description: List of PathPoint messages, encoding the path points.

field.name: North Offset (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

field.name: East Offset (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

field.name: Down Offset (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

message.name: Yo-Yo Maneuver
message.description: A "yo-yo" is a maneuver specifying a movement vehicle to a target waypoint in which depth/altitude varies along the way between two values with a desired pitch angle.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Pitch Angle
field.description: Pitch angle for use in ascent/descent.

message.name: Teleoperation Done
message.description: Notification of completion of a Teleoperation maneuver.

message.name: Sub Plan
message.description: Execute a sub-plan.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Speed
field.description: The value of the desired speed, in the scale specified by the "Speed Units" field.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the speed value.

message.name: Elevator Maneuver
message.description: The Elevator maneuver specifies a vehicle to reach a target waypoint using a cruise altitude/depth and then ascend or descend to another target altitude/depth. The ascent/descent slope and radius can also be optionally specified.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

value.name: Start from current position
value.description: If this flag is set, lat/lon/start_z fields should be ignored and current vehicle position should be considered as starting point for ascent/descent.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the start point's z reference

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: units of the end point's z reference

field.name: Pitch Angle
field.description: Pitch angle for use in ascent/descent. If 0 the controller to should use a custom control strategy.

field.name: Radius
field.description: Radius for use in ascent/descent. If 0 the controller to should use a custom control strategy.

field.name: Duration
field.description: The duration of time vehicle should remain at the target altitude/depth level.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: North Offset (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the trajectory start point.

field.name: East Offset (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the trajectory start point.

field.name: Down Offset (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the trajectory start point.

field.name: Time Offset (s)
field.description: The time offset relative to the previous trajectory point.

message.name: Custom Maneuver
message.description: The Custom Maneuver message may be used as specification of a very specific maneuver not covered by the IMC scope. The settings of the maneuver are just its id, timeout and other settings encoded as a tuple list.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Maneuver Name
field.description: The maneuver name, used as key by an implementation to bind the maneuver to the corresponding controller.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: Start Time
field.description: Optional start time hint for vehicle formation.

message.name: Vehicle Formation Participant
message.description: Definition of a vehicle participant in a VehicleFormation maneuver.

message.name: Stop Maneuver
message.description: Command used to stop currently executing maneuver.

message.name: Register Maneuver
message.description: Command used to indicate maneuver can be executed in the vehicle.

field.name: Maneuver ID
field.description: IMC serialization ID of maneuver type.

message.name: Maneuver Control State
message.description: Maneuver control state.

value.name: Maneuver in progress
value.description: Maneuver in progress.

value.name: Maneuver completed
value.description: Maneuver completed.

value.name: Maneuver error
value.description: Maneuver error.

field.name: Completion Time
field.description: Estimated time to completion of the maneuver, when executing. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined.

message.name: Follow System
message.description: System-following maneuver.

field.name: System To Follow
field.description: IMC address of system to follow.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Duration of maneuver, 0 for unlimited duration.

field.name: Coordinate -- Z
field.description: Coordinate z during follow maneuver. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

message.name: Communications Relay
message.description: In this maneuver, a vehicle drives to the center of two other systems (a, b) in order to be used as a communications relay.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Duration of maneuver, 0 for unlimited duration.

field.name: System A
field.description: The IMC id of the system A

field.name: System B
field.description: The IMC id of the system B

field.name: Move threshold
field.description: Move only if the distance to the target is bigger than this treshold

message.name: Cover Area
message.description: Given a polygonal area, generates trajectories to cover the area.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.

field.name: CustomParameters
field.description: Additional parameters to be used by the controller

message.name: Polygon Vertex
message.description: This message is used to store the various polygon vertices for CoverArea maneuvers.

message.name: Warning Signal
message.description: Request the vehicle to issue a warning signal, typically when about to start moving.

message.name: Vehicle State
message.description:
Vehicle state.

This message summarizes the overall state of the vehicle. It can contains information regarding:
  • The overall operation mode.
  • Any error conditions.
  • Current maneuver execution.
  • Active control loops.

value.name: Service
value.description: Ready to service requests.

value.name: Calibration
value.description: Ongoing vehicle calibration.

value.name: Error
value.description: Errors are set.

value.name: Maneuver
value.description: A maneuver is executing.

value.name: External Control
value.description: External control is active.

field.name: Errors -- Entities
field.description: The monitored entities with error conditions. This is a comma separated list of entity names.

field.name: Maneuver -- Type
field.description: Type of maneuver being executed, when in MANEUVER mode. The value is the IMC serialization ID of the corresponding maneuver.

field.name: Maneuver -- Start Time
field.description: Start time of maneuver being executed (Epoch time), when in MANEUVER mode.

field.name: Maneuver -- ETA
field.description: Estimated time for maneuver completion. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined.

message.name: Vehicle Command
message.description: Vehicle command.

field.name: Command
field.description: The type of command/action to be performed

value.name: Execute Maneuver
value.description: Execute the maneuver specified in 'maneuver' field.

value.name: Stop Maneuver
value.description: Stop 'maneuver' being executed.

value.name: Calibrate
value.description: Calibrate vehicle.

message.name: Monitor Entity State
message.description: Controls monitoring of entity states in the vehicle.

field.name: Entity Names
field.description: Comma separated list of entity names.

field.name: Entities monitored - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names being monitored.

field.name: Entities with errors - Count
field.description: Number of entitities with non-critical errors.

field.name: Entities with errors - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names with non-critical errors.

field.name: Entities with critical errors - Count
field.description: Number of entitities with critical errors.

field.name: Entities with critical errors - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names with critical errors.

message.name: Operational Limits
message.description: Definition of operational limits.

message.name: Get Operational Limits
message.description: Command to obtain the operational limits in use by the vehicle.

message.name: Calibration
message.description: Initiate overall calibration of a vehicle.

message.name: Control Loops
message.description: Enable or disable control loops.

message.name: Vehicle Links
message.description: This message is sent by the TREX task which gives further information to a TREX instance about connected IMC nodes

field.name: Local Name
field.description: The name of the vehicle being controlled

field.name: Active Links
field.description: A list of Announce messages with last announces heard

message.name: TREX Goal
message.description: This message is sent by the TREX task in order to post or delete high-level objectives of the TREX executive

field.name: Operation
field.description: The type of operation to be commanded

field.name: Goal Id
field.description: The id of the goal, if applicable

field.name: Goal XML
field.description: The goal encoded as XML, if applicable

message.name: Abort
message.description: Stops any executing actions and put the system in a standby mode.

message.name: Plan Specification
message.description:
Identity and description of a plan's general parameters, associated with plan loading (i.e. load plan command in PlanCommand).

A plan specification is defined by a plan identifier, a set of maneuver specifications and a start maneuver from that set.

See the PlanManeuver message for details on maneuver specification.

field.name: Starting maneuver
field.description: Indicates the id of the starting maneuver for this plan.

message.name: Plan Maneuver
message.description: Named plan maneuver.

message.name: Plan Transition
message.description: Describes a plan transition within a plan specification. A transition states the vehicle conditions that must be met to signal the transition, the maneuver that should be started as a result, and an optional set of actions triggered by the transition.

field.name: Source
field.description: Comma separated list of maneuver IDs, or the special value '.' to identify a global plan transition.

field.name: Destination Maneuver Name
field.description: Target maneuver name. If it equals the special value '_done_' then plan should terminate with a success status. If it equals the special value '_error_' then the plan should terminate with an error status.

field.name: Transition conditions
field.description: Comma separated list of conditions for transition. Each condition identifier corresponds to a known predicate which is interpreted and tested internally by the vehicle.

field.name: Transition actions
field.description: Messages processed when the transition is triggered.

message.name: Plan DB
message.description: Request/reply to plan database.

field.name: Type
field.description:
Indicates if the message is a request, or a reply to a previous request.

In case of a reply, the type indicates if the operation either:
  1. succeded;
  2. failed;
  3. is in progress.

field.name: Operation
field.description:
Indicates the operation affecting the DB.

The operation may relate to a single plan or the entire plan DB. For each request, a plan DB may reply with any number of 'in progress' replies followed by a success or a failure reply.

The 'op', 'request_id' and 'plan_id' fields of a request will be echoed in one or more responses to that request. The operation at stake also determines a certain type of the 'arg' field, and whether or not the 'plan_id' field needs to be set.

value.name: Set Plan
value.description:
Set a plan in the DB.

The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan, and a pre-existing plan with the same identifier, if any will be overwritten. For requests, the 'arg' field must contain a 'PlanSpecification' message.

value.name: Delete Plan
value.description:
Delete a plan from the DB.

The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan to delete.

value.name: Get Plan
value.description:
Get a plan stored in the DB.

The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanSpecification' message in the 'arg' field.

value.name: Get Plan Info
value.description:
Get DB state for a stored plan.

The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBInformation' message in the 'arg' field.

value.name: Clear Database
value.description: Clear the entire DB.

value.name: Get Database State (Simple)
value.description:
Get state of the entire DB.

Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBState' message in the 'arg' field but without individual plan information (in the 'plans_info' field of 'PlanDBState').

value.name: Get Database State (Detailed)
value.description:
Get detailed state of the entire DB.

Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBState' message in the 'arg' field with individual plan information (in the 'plans_info' field of 'PlanDBState').

value.name: Boot Notification
value.description: PlanDB replies of this type are sent automatically during bootstrap.

field.name: Request ID
field.description:
Request ID.

This may be used by interfacing modules, e.g. using sequence counters, to annotate requests and appropriately identify replies

field.name: Plan ID
field.description: Plan identifier for the operation, if one is required.

field.name: Complementary Information
field.description:
Human-readable complementary information.

For example this may be used to detail reasons for failure, or to report in-progress information.

message.name: Plan DB State
message.description: Characterizes the state of the entire plan database.

field.name: Plan -- Size of all plans
field.description:
Size of all plans.

The value equals the sum of the IMC payload sizes for 'PlanSpecification' stored in the DB.

field.name: Last Change -- Source Address
field.description: IMC address for source of last DB change.

field.name: Last Change -- Source Name
field.description: IMC node name for source of last DB change.

field.name: MD5
field.description:
MD5 database verification code.

The MD5 hash sum is computed over the stream formed by the MD5 of all plans, ordered by plan id, in compliance with RFC 1321.

field.name: Plan Size
field.description:
Plan size.

The value equals the IMC message payload of the associated 'PlanSpecification' message in bytes.

field.name: Last Changed -- Time
field.description: Time of last change to the plan (Epoch time).

field.name: Last Change -- Source Address
field.description: IMC address for source of last change to the plan.

field.name: Last Change -- Source Name
field.description: IMC node name for source of last change to the plan.

field.name: MD5
field.description:
MD5 plan verification code.

The value is calculated over the message payload of the 'PlanSpecification', in compliance with RFC 1321.

message.name: Plan Control
message.description: Plan control request/reply.

field.name: Type
field.description: Indicates if the message is a request, or a reply to a previous request. In case of a reply, the type indicates if either: (1) the operation was successfull; (2) failed; or (3), is still in progress. The 'op', 'request_id' and 'plan_id' fields of a request will be echoed in one or more responses to that request.

value.name: Start Plan
value.description: Start plan identified by 'plan_id' field. The command will try to load the corresponding plan if none is loaded, and in that case will follow the same discipline as the 'LOAD' command. This will override any current plan being executed.

value.name: Stop Plan
value.description: Stop current plan being executed if any.

value.name: Load Plan
value.description: Load Plan. If a 'PlanSpecification' is given with the request in the 'data' field, then that plan is used and stored in the Plan DB. Otherwise, the plan is loaded from the Plan DB.

value.name: Get Plan
value.description: Get loaded plan. For a successful reply, the 'data' field will contain the 'PlanSpecification' message that corresponds to the currently loaded plan.

field.name: Request ID
field.description: Request ID. This may be used by interfacing modules e.g. using sequence counters. to annotate requests and appropriately identify replies

field.name: Plan ID
field.description: Identifier of plan. For START command this may be suffixed by ":<start node>" where <start node> identifies a start node in the plan (see 'PlanNode' message). If none is specified the default start node of the plan will be used (see 'PlanNode' message).

value.name: Calibrate Vehicle
value.description: Perform vehicle calibration.

field.name: Complementary Info
field.description: Complementary human-readable information. This is used in association to replies.

message.name: Plan Control State
message.description: State of plan control.

value.name: Blocked
value.description: Plan execution is blocked e.g., due to a vehicle error, or if no plan is loaded.

value.name: Ready
value.description: Ready to start plan execution.

value.name: Initializing
value.description: Initializing plan for execution.

value.name: Executing
value.description: Executing plan.

field.name: Plan -- Start Time
field.description: Plan start time, if a plan is being executed.

field.name: Node -- ID
field.description: Current node ID, when executing a plan.

field.name: Node -- Type
field.description: Type of maneuver being executed (IMC serialization id), when executing a plan.

field.name: Node -- Start Time
field.description: Current node start time, when executing a plan.

field.name: Node -- ETA
field.description: Current node estimated time to completion, when executing a plan. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined.

field.name: Last Event -- Description
field.description: Description of last event in plan control.

message.name: Plan Variable
message.description: A plan variable.

message.name: Plan Generation
message.description: This message is used to order the generation of plans based on id and set of parameters.

value.name: Generate
value.description: Generate the plan and store it in the PlanDB.

value.name: Execute
value.description: Generate (storing it in the PlanDB) and execute it immediately.

value.name: Request
value.description: Request the execution of this command.

value.name: Error
value.description: Some error has occurred while executing the command. The error can be found in the 'params' tuplelist (under the key 'error').

value.name: Success
value.description: The requested command was executed successfully.

field.name: Plan Identifier
field.description: The name of the plan to be generated.

field.name: Parameters
field.description: An optional list of parameters to be used by the plan generation module.

message.name: Reported State
message.description: A vehicle state that is reported to other consoles (including PDAConsole). Source can be acoustic tracker, SMS, Wi-Fi, etc...

field.name: Depth
field.description: The reported depth. In the case of not knowing the depth 0 will be reported. Airplanes usually have negative values (por positive altitude).

field.name: Roll
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Reception Time
field.note: Correct interpretation of this field may require synchronization of clocks between sender and recipient
field.description: The time when the packet was sent, as seen by the packet dispatcher. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970 using IEEE double precision floating point numbers.

field.name: System Identifier
field.description: The id of the system whose position is being reported (it can be a vehicle's id, a boat name, etc)

message.name: Remote Sensor Info
message.description: Whenever the CUCS receives a message from one of the existing sensors (through SMS, ZigBee, Acoustic Comms, ...) it disseminates that info recurring to this message.

field.name: Id
field.description: An unique string that identifies the sensor. Used mostly for logging/presentation.

field.name: Class
field.description: The class of a sensor tells the type of sensor originating this message. It will determine how the sensor is to be shown and (optionally) how the custom data (tuplelist) is to be interpreted.

message.name: Map
message.description: This message represents a simple map that is transferred between CCU consoles (from Neptus to ACCU)

message.name: Map Feature
message.description: A feature to appear on the map

field.name: Identifier
field.description: The unique identifier for this feature (used as the name for points of interest)

value.name: Point of Interest
value.description: These features should appear as a point with a label in the map

value.name: Filled Polygon
value.description: These features should be represented as a filled polygon (no label)

value.name: Countoured Polygon
value.description: These features should be represented as a countoured closed polygon (no fill and no label)

value.name: Line
value.description: These features should be represented as an open polygon (no label)

value.name: Transponder
value.description: A transponder location in the map

value.name: Start Location
value.description: Intended vehicle's starting location

value.name: Home Reference
value.description: The offsets reference for this map

field.name: RedComponent
field.description: The red component of the color for this point

field.name: GreenComponent
field.description: The green component of the color for this point

field.name: BlueComponent
field.description: The blue component of the color for this point

message.name: MapPoint
message.description: This message represents a point in the world.

message.name: Acoustic Systems Listing
message.description: This message allows querying of the configured acoustic systems in the manta gateway

field.name: Systems Listing
field.description: The configured systems as comma-separated text. Example: "lsts1,lsts2,lauv-seacon-1". Used onle when operation is RESPONSE.

message.name: Navigation State
message.description: Navigation State (added for development purposes).

message.name: LBL Estimator Log
message.description: LBL Estimator logging message (added for development purposes).

message.name: LBL Beacon Position Estimate
message.description: LBL Beacon position estimate.

message.name: Remote State
message.description: State summary for a remote vehicle.

message.name: Piccolo Waypoint
message.description: List of waypoints. This is sent upon update by the external device, or in request to a WaypointList message.

field.name: Index of Next Waypoint
field.description: Identifier of waypoint that follows the execution of this waypoint (100 if not defined).

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Altitude or depth. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Loiter Radius
field.description: Loitering radius. For waypoints with no loitering, this value is 0.

field.name: Loiter Time
field.description: Loiter duration, if loitering is defined for the waypoint. A value of 0 indicates indefinite loiter time.

message.name: List Piccolo Waypoints
message.description: Require list of waypoints defined for the external device.

message.name: Piccolo Waypoint Deleted
message.description: Informs that a waypoint has been deleted.

message.name: Piccolo Tracking State
message.description: Indicates the waypoint tracked by the vehicle.

field.name: Source Waypoint Identifier
field.description: Optional source waypoint identifier (100 if not defined).

message.name: Piccolo Packet
message.description: Piccolo data packet.

message.name: Goto Piccolo Waypoint
message.description: Command Piccolo to goto to indicated waypoint.

message.name: Piccolo Control Configuration
message.description: Get/set Piccolo Piccolo control configuration

message.name: Transmission Request
message.description: This message is used to request transmission of IMC messages to a certain destination.

value.name: Start transmission request
value.description: Request transmission to the specified node.

value.name: Stop transmission request
value.description: Request that transmission to the specified node is ceased.

value.name: Transmitting
value.description: The transmission to this destination has started or was already being done.

value.name: Not transmitting
value.description: The transmission to this destination has been ceased or is not being started by the (optional) given reason.

field.name: Destination
field.description: The IMC identifier of the node that wants to start receiving IMC messages.

field.name: Additional Information
field.description: Both requests and replies can supply additional information using this field.

field.name: Interfacing Entity ID
field.description: A way to encapsulate entities to be controlled. The idea is to have a way to not only provide authorization control on other modules other than payloads (for example plan controllers interface).

field.name: Authorizable Interfacing Level
field.description: This will indicate the abitily for the system to be externally controlled.

field.name: Grantee System ID
field.description: For a responce this will be the ID of the authoriation holder. If this id is the null id (0xFFFF), then is informative information on Authorizable Intefacing Level.

field.name: Power Channel ID
field.description: VER SE SÓ COM A MSG EntityControl DÁ

message.name: Multi-hop message
message.description: This message can be used to transmit a message to a multihop destination in the network.

field.name: Final Destination
field.description: The node to where this message is destinated.

field.name: Maximum number of hops
field.description: The maximum number of retransmissions for this message.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The timeout for delivery, in seconds.

value.name: Act as intermediate relay
value.description: Retransmit this message if destination is within communication range.

value.name: Allow message forwarding
value.description: Retransmit this message if destination is not within communication range.

value.name: Store message locally
value.description: Store this message until destination is within communication range.

value.name: Move towards destination
value.description: If idle, move towards the (estimated) location of the destination.

field.name: Data
field.description: The data bundle that is to be delivered to another point in the network.

message.name: Payload Configuration Control
message.description: This message is used to set / retrieve the currently available list of payloads in the vehicle as well as its configuration.

value.name: Payload Listing
value.description: List of available payloads together with their configuration.

value.name: Request Payload Listing
value.description: Request the vehicle to list its available payloads.

value.name: Get Default Payload Configurations
value.description: Request the vehicle to list the default configurations to all available payloads.

value.name: Set Payload Configurations
value.description: Send a list of configurations to be set on the vehicle

field.name: Entity Id
field.description: The entity id (as advertised in EntityList).

field.name: Configuration
field.description: The configuration message related to this payload.

message.name: Servo Position
message.description: Actual position of a servo.

message.name: Target
message.description: Target.

field.name: Z Reference
field.description: Maneuver reference in the z axis. Use z_units to specify whether z represents depth, altitude or other.
